intro: Combretum woodii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that turn yellow in autumn, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical climates. Its rapid growth and vibrant floral display make it a popular choice for landscaping and ornamental gardening.
